result.execSummary:
The defendant Donovan J Defoe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Not to consume any alcohol.   Not to consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed Doctor.

Any and all conditions DOC may impose.  Absolute sobriety.  All assessments that are recommended and any follow thru.  Must continue to take prescribed medication to deal with his medical issues.  Must submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donovan J Defoe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donovan J Defoe in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Donovan J Defoe in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  8:15 AM Court calls case.  Atty Frost recites appearances.  State argues sentencing requests court follow PSI.  Atty McL states 170 days credit time served.  Attorney's stipulate to days credit.  Atty McL makes arguement.  Defendant addressed the Court.

COURT:  Sentence impose/stayed:  4 years  Prison 2 yrs in and 2 yrs ES Stayed - probation 5 years - costs - any and all conditions DOC may impose - 180 days county jail with credit for 170 days time served - absolute sobriety - no alcohol/no drugs - all assessments that are recommended and any follow thru - continue to take prescribed medication to deal with medical issues - DNA sample and surcharge - eligible for challange and substance abuse program 

Atty MCL makes stmt
Sentencing hearing on August 1, 2014 at 08:05 am.

Defendant, Donovan J Defoe appeared with Attorney James C McLaughlin.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances.  Atty McLaughlin states the plea agreement between the def. and the state.  The def. would plead to n/c to count 1, count 2 and 3.  A PSI will be ordered. Brief recess as 11:44am-DA will get Information.  Back on the record at 11:46.  Information is provided to the court and the defendant. Court speaks to Mr. Defoe. Atty McLaughlin speaks to the court. Mr. Defoe will waive his right of preliminary examination. Court speaks to Mr. Defoe. Court finds that there was probable cause and that Mr. Defoe commited a crime in Washburn and his decision is freely and knowningly waived. Court binds Mr. Defore over for trial. Court discusses the information that was provided.  Mr. Defoe pleads no contest to count 1.  Court reviews the plea questionaire and waiver of rights with Mr. Defoe. Atty McLaughlin speaks to Mr. Defoe regarding his rights. Court finds that Mr. Defoe understands the charges that he was charged with. Court finds that Mr. Defoe freely and knowingly understands the plea questionaire and waiver of rights. Mr. Defoe pleads no contest to count 1, by pleading no contest Court finds him guilty to count 1. Court orders a PSI.  Atty McLaghlin does not require the agent to appear at sentencing.  Count 2 and 3 are dismissed but read-in. Bail will continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 08:05 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donovan J Defoe in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Donovan J Defoe in custody.  Thomas Henry Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 3:43pm. Mr. Frost will submit the complaint and attachments including the photo is enough to establish probable cause. Mr. McLaughlin speaks to the court and objects. Objections are noted for the record but denied. Court addresses Attorney McLaughlin regarding Deputy Harrington as one of the responding officers. Mr. McLaughlin asks that the court recuse himself from the case. Court recuses himself from the case. The request from Attorney McLaughlin is granted. Bail will continue.
Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant, Donovan J Defoe appeared with Attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Attorney Thomas Henry Frost appeared for the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant, Donovan J Defoe appeared with out an attorney. Attorney Thomas Frost represents the state.  Mr. Defoe does not have a lawyer. Court speaks to Mr. Defoe stating that he needs lawyer for a preliminary exam.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donovan J Defoe in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Defendant Donovan J Defoe in custody.  Thomas H. Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Jarvis waived reading.  Court entered NG as to misd.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Not to have any contact with Spooner McDonalds or that area.
